verses.roman:
yavana-sakalera 'mukti' habe anāyāse
'hā rāma, hā rāma' bali' kahe nāmābhāse

synonyms: yavana-sakalera—of all the yavanas; mukti—liberation; habe—there will be; anāyāse—very easily; hā rāma hā rāma—O Lord Rāma, O Lord Rāma; bali'-saying; kahe—they say; nāma-ābhāse—almost chanting the holy name of the Lord without offenses.
translation: "Because the yavanas are accustomed to saying, 'hā rāma, hā rāma' [O Lord Rāmacandra], they will very easily be delivered by this nāmābhāsa.
